001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.annotation;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
004import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
005import java.lang.annotation.Target;
006
007/**
008 * Defines test data to be used within a pre-test setup journey.
009 *
010 * <p>This annotation is used in combination with {@code @Journey} to specify
011 * predefined test data models that should be injected during the execution
012 * of a test precondition.
013 *
014 * <p>The framework resolves the specified data model dynamically using reflection,
015 * ensuring that the appropriate test data object is provided as part of the test setup.
016 *
017 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
018 */
019@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
020@Target({})
021public @interface JourneyData {
022
023   /**
024    * Specifies the test data model to be injected.
025    *
026    * <p>The value should match a predefined test data identifier, which the framework
027    * resolves dynamically to generate the corresponding test object.
028    *
029    * @return The name of the test data model.
030    */
031   String value();
032
033   /**
034    * Indicates whether the test data should be created lazily.
035    *
036    * <p>If set to {@code true}, the test data object is not created immediately.
037    * Instead, it remains a deferred reference and must be explicitly accessed
038    * when needed.
039    * <br>
040    * If set to {@code false}, the object is created just before the test execution,
041    * ensuring it is available during the test.
042    *
043    * @return {@code true} if the test data should be created lazily and requires
044    *     explicit resolution before use, otherwise {@code false}.
045    */
046   boolean late() default false;
047
048}
